description: You could create a smart coffe table where you could aaccess al the smart features in your house and also have a key board too
You could create credit card size tablets that you could carry in your wallet or purse
You could coat every inch of you walls and have a house that changes looks when even you want it to. A custom house everyday if you wanted
spray on the walls and have a full size digital fish tank
Smart windows. You could block out bad weather or change when the sun rises or sets inside your home. Also, you could have spring or fall scenes whenever you wanted
create a digital phone system anywhere you would want.

On any wall in a house, you could use this coating to turn the wall into a touch screen display to control the temperature in the house. The wall would bring up the current temperature, options to lower and raise the temperature, as well as automatic settings that can controlled based on the user's input.
On a refrigerator, this coating could be placed in order to control the temperature of the refrigerator as well as provide the user with a list of what's inside.
A digital lock for a car. A number could be typed into the touch display on the car allowing a person to unlock their car without their keys.
A touch screen display on the table at a restaurant. Customers would be able to bring up the menu on the table's display to order their food and pay their bill.
A display on your cabinet that allows you to order the basic necessities such as toilet paper, tooth paste, and other house hold needs.

A tuner for an instrument. A guitar could benefit from this by having the display act as a tuner for the guitar. Different tunes for the guitar could be options and directions would display on the touch screen.
A display for a wallet. The display would allow a user to view their digital currency such as debit and credit card balances without opening their wallet.
turn the floor into an interactive dance guide to tell you where to place your feet and practice your timing.
create a display on bookshelves either at home or in a library to show a list of the books on the shelf to make it easier to find what you are looking for.
create a display on the car windshield to show a gps map so you can keep your eyes forward and on the road and navigate more safely.
Interactive panels on devices used for food preparation - you can use your hands to check items off a list as you accomplish them, etc.
Children's toys could have instructional videos on how to use them or creative ways to use them so children will find them engaging for greater periods of time.
Add touch screens to prescriptions to have them play audio recordings (screen might be too small for video recordings) about how to use the medicine inside, interactions, side effects, etc.
Put cheaper/cruder touch screens (as they could be damaged) on animal toys so they can play audio stimuli to keep pets engaged and active.
Put one on the outside of your home so that you could unlock your home with a physical pattern, much like you do with a cell phone.

If they are pressure sensitive, put one in a place where something is supposed to be, so that it can alert you if the item is not there - i.e. if you put your phone somewhere, place a pressure pad there so that it can let you know you put your phone in a place where you don't want it to be.
Place them on the ground so that you can control simple actions with your feet - turning a light on and off, opening a door, etc., while keeping your hands free for whatever you are doing.

Digital two dimensional sliders could be used for a number of purposes and would be better than conventional sliders because they would allow for a much greater range of motion. Imagine a slider you use for your light - if the slider had to be made so that it could reach any given point in a square instead of just being able to move in one dimension, that might be very expensive and inconvenient. Perhaps the slider could control light brightness, on one axis, and light hue (white, blue, etc.) on the other.

TV remote with a touchscreen so that you could add/move/change different screen elements of a smart TV with a greater degree of freedom - you could shrink the main picture if you wanted to check something on the guide screen or something similar.
Turn any table into a whiteboard for ideas by coating a table with it. You can write on the table, scribble down notes, drag and drop items to help with organization, etc.

Coat toolboxes so that you can label what the boxes contain and organize your tools in an efficient manner. For instance, one toolbox will hold wrenches and screwdrivers while another holds handheld tools.

Apply the coating to doors to serve as indicators for whether or not you are home, whether a business is open or closed, whether or not visitors or solicitors are welcome. You can also use it the write down reminders for when you are leaving the house, such as "Don't forget your keys," etc.

Apply the coating to windows which allow you to create privacy screens or advertising space. Businesses can use the coating to turn any large window into a billboard. Civilians can use the coating to increase personal privacy by displaying black screens or other images to prevent people from peeping.

Coat storage tanks to create informative indicators for how much space or product remains in the tanks. For example, a farmer might have a silo that he fills with grain. Coating the silo with this to turn it into a display would allow him to see how much space remains in the silo, or how much grain is contained within the silo.

validatedConcepts.token: shop for during future grocery trips

description: Touch screen refrigerator and freezer to indicate the temperature of the unit, show the food contained within, and indicate expiration dates of various food stuffs. The door can also provide a list of things that the person needs to shop for during future grocery trips.
Coat a road surface with it to show how much and when maintenance might be required. This makes it easier for government agencies to determine which roads are in need of repair.
Turn a shower door into a note pad for jotting down shower thoughts or and random ideas you may have while undergoing your daily grooming or self-care routine.
Turn any heater into an individual thermostat by allowing the user to see how much heat is being produced by the heater. The person can then adjust the heater as needed and save on utility costs.

One idea would be to make a paint that when dry will turn your walls or whatever you paint with it into a touch sensitive display. You would be able to program which parts do what when you touch them, and be able to change the color of the paint at will and you wouldn't ever need a TV or computer screens as you could just make them on your walls.

You could apply the coating to the visor of a motorcycle helmet, assuming it's transparent you could use it to tell you things like the weather, your speed, messages from people, and so on, without having to stop or look at another screen and be distracted.
You could apply the coating to your wrist or the back of your hand to have a watch that you would never need to take off.
You could apply the coating to all the door handles in your home or building and program them to only open when someone with the right fingerprint tries to open them.
You could apply the coating onto a bottle and when you touch it, have it tell you how much fluid is left in it and what exactly the fluid is, as well as the temperature of the fluid.

Combining the power and interactivity of tablet computers and the size and display of high definition televisions. Being able to touch tv's to select applications, channel guides, and even play video games with the tips of your fingers.

I'd like to use that coating to improve security for cars. Nowadays, you're able to enter your car with key codes, apps on your phone, fobs, etc. But nothing is more secure than being able to use your fingerprint to unlock or lock your vehicle. Or being able to use all those methods at once would reduce theft of vehicles by a large amount.
Touch screen refrigerator that can list the food items contained within it. Also, it can adjust the temperature of the fridge and order items when you run out from delivery services.

Put the coating on tables in restaurants. Kids like to make a mess when eating out. Having something like a virtual display on the table would make a great distraction by allowing children to doodle drawings while they wait.

Use it on furniture to draw and design different patterns that match the rest of your living room. Also, the coating could be used to make such designs that cover over past spills and stains on the couch.

Put the coating on a bed. That layer of a touch display could record sleep patterns, heart beat and rhythms, and other body functions while you sleep. You could sync it up to an application to have a table of information to review.
We could use the technology to skin the exterior of building facades to make interactive walls.
The display incorporated into furniture surfaces so that people could change their aesthetic on a whim.
Using the technology on cups so that they display the type of beverage contained within.
Incorporate the technology onto automotive windsheilds so they can display map directions.
Applied to floors and sidewalks so that people can use it for directions where they want to go.
Used in lieu of tattoos as a form of body art.

A touch screen could be placed in conjunction with a large wardrobe. The touch screen would allow the user to mix and match outfits visually. The device would keep track of all items of clothing and would display the last instances of washing and wearing.
a bracelet that emits projector like thing on your forearm in which you can use android properties even in bath or wet  surface.
a digital memo pad that is placed on the refrigerator that serves as a reminder note.

Touch screen on the wall in a house. It can adjust virtually everything in the house including temperature and other electronics.
Touch screen on dumbbells that tells you how many reps you have done.
Touch screen on arm rest of couch. This will allow you to change the channel without needing a remote.
Screen on the window of a house. This window can tell you the temperature on it and with a press of a button, can darken the window so that no sunlight passes through.

Interactive maps of the galaxy, it will allow us to explore what we currently know about space. Let us zoom in, click meteorites, planets, and stars for facts.

It allows for the budgeting of cash, and the protection of using a card that is not linked to your bank account, but can also be used over and over and conveniently. Spray a card, load $10 on it, and send your kid to the store for whatever it is you need.
